result.execSummary:
The defendant Marshall F Kolbeck was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marshall F Kolbeck

2:02 PM Defendant Marshall F Kolbeck in court.  Attorney Adam Kerner in court for Marshall F Kolbeck.  Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Flynn in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 

Parties are prepared to proceed with plea/sentencing today. 

State puts offer on the record. Defense confirms offer. 

Plea questionnaire filed. Court holds plea colloquy with defendant. 

Case 20CT300
Plea - Ct. 1: GUILTY 
State consents to jury waiver. 
Agreement to use complaint for factual basis. 
BTC: GUILTY. Ct. 2 is dismissed but read in. 
Parties give arguments as to sentencing. 

BTC: 38 days Racine County Jail; 38 days credit for time served. 
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
Court Costs+ DNA surcharge, payment plan $50/month beginning: October 1, 2022.

BTC: 32 days Racine County Jail; 32 days credit for time served.

Status conference on August 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:08 AM Prosecuting attorney Raymond Robert Rutz III in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Marshall F Kolbeck in court, in custody.  Attorney Adam Kerner in court for Marshall F Kolbeck. Court Reporter: Saige Smith. 
Defense puts statements on the record. Seeking to have bonds in each case moved to signature bonds
State objects to changing the cash bonds that have already been set in cases 22CM769 & 21CM812. Provides arguments.
BTC: VACATE WARRANT and $500 signature bond set in case 20CT300. Defense's motion to modify bonds in cases 22CM769 & 21CM812 is denied.  Matter set over. 
Status conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. Do not drive unless properly licensed. Must install IID device. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. No ncontact with Kari Pavia and Michael Cantwell.

2:27 PM Prosecuting attorney Dirk Christian Jensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Marshall F Kolbeck appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Adam Kerner appeared by video for Marshall F Kolbeck. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on July 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Initial appearance on July 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
